html: On behalf of our whole family, thank you to Principal Andy Payne, teachers, and faculty at Perdue Elementary for what you do for the children of Houston County. I know my father would be proud of all you’ve accomplished over the last 25 years.pic.twitter.com/eDVtRW8HLZ
text: On behalf of our whole family, thank you to Principal Andy Payne, teachers, and faculty at Perdue Elementary for what you do for the children of Houston County. I know my father would be proud of all you’ve accomplished over the last 25 years.pic.twitter.com/eDVtRW8HLZ

html: If my dad were with us today, I think he’d say that it’s not about the name on the building, or who the principal is, or who the teachers are. It’s about the children.
text: If my dad were with us today, I think he’d say that it’s not about the name on the building, or who the principal is, or who the teachers are. It’s about the children.

html: In 1993, Perdue Elementary School opened its doors to the children of Houston County. It was named after my father, David A.
